snippet: Lawmakers have been working across party lines on legislation advocates say could help keep killers like the gunman in Newtown, Conn., from slipping through the cracks.
abstract: Lawmakers are quietly working across party lines on legislation that advocates say could help prevent killers like Adam Lanza, gunman in Newtown, Conn, massacre, from slipping through the cracks; proponents say plans could lead to some of the most significant advancements in years in treating mental illness and address a problem that people on both sides of issue agree is a root cause of gun rampages.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers have been working across party lines on legislation advocates say could help keep killers like the gunman in Newtown, Conn., from slipping through the cracks.

headline.seo: Senators Make Bipartisan Push for Mental Health Care
headline.main: In Gun Debate, No Rift on Better Care for Mentally Ill
headline.print_headline: From Gun Debate, Accord Emerges On Mental Care
